info.name: Will Sutherland
description: I'm Will Sutherland, a Software Developer and student at The University of Sheffield.
I am Entering the final year of my Computer Science degree.
I have received multiple awards from the university for my academic excellence and projects.
I am a member of the University Hockey Club and the Computer Science Society Football Team.
I regularly contribute to GitHub, and I have completed 2 internships at HP Autonomy.

awards.name: The British Computer Society Eliot Chat Prize for the Best Overall Performance at Level 2
awards.reason: Awarded for being top of the year in 2nd year.

awards.name: IBM Software Hut Prize
awards.reason: Awarded for having the best Software Hut project in the year.

awards.name: Client Software Hut Prize
awards.reason: Awarded for having the best Software Hut project out of the teams working for our client.

awards.name: recognised@HP Commendation
awards.awarded_by: Sean Blanchflower, Head of R&D at HP Autonomy
awards.reason: Awarded for creating the HP IDOL Query Visualiser, Orbit.

awards.name: John Wiley & Sons Ltd. Prize for the Best Overall Performance at Level 1
awards.reason: Awarded for being top of the year in 1st year.

awards.name: epiGenesys Scholarship for Outstanding Academic Achievement
awards.reason: Awarded for being top of the year after January exams in 1st year.

awards.name: Global Engineering Challenge: Best Overall Solution
awards.reason: Awarded for having the best project proposal in our hub.

description: Created Orbit, an interactive query visualiser designed to illustrate advanced search techniques within HP's Big Data product suite, using the D3.js graphics library.
Orbit was demoed to and well received by the executive vice president of HP Software.
Created a RESTful API to act as an update tracker for HP IDOL servers using Node.js and MySQL, along with a companion CMS built with the frontend JavaScript framework Backbone.js.

projects.name: SideRank
projects.description: A web application for business employees to evaluate solutions to challenges proposed by their employer. Created for the company sideways6 as part of the module 'Software Hut'. Our application was chosen to be the winner by the client, as well as being chosen as the best application in the year.

projects.name: blog
projects.description: My blog, written using Jekyll, the static site generator.

projects.name: Gradients
projects.description: A web application for students to store their grades and track their progress.

projects.name: Cisco IoE Challenge
projects.description: Proactively manage the passenger flow at Transport Service Facilities in Greater Manchester.

projects.name: Orbit
projects.description: An interactive query visualiser designed to illustrate advanced search techniques within HP's Big Data product suite.

projects.name: Update Tracker
projects.description: A RESTful API that tracks updates for HP IDOL servers, along with a companion CMS.

projects.name: Phloto
projects.description: Display a user's Instagram posts as a flowing grid.
